section.title: Overview
section.para:
The module implements the History-Info extensions as per RFC 7044. The history_info extensions are useful in various scenarios involving call forwarding. Typically one needs to communicate the original recipient of the call to the PSTN gateway and this is what the history_info extensions can be used for.
Similar to Diversion header field, but IETF standardized.

section.title: External Libraries or Applications
section.para:
The following libraries or applications must be installed before running &kamailio; with this module loaded:
None.

section.title: suffix (string)
section.para: The suffix to be appended to the end of the header field. You can use the parameter to specify additional parameters to be added to the header field, see the example.

The function adds a new history_info header field before any other existing History-Info header field in the message (the newly added History-Info header field will become the topmost History-Info header field). If 'uri' parameter is missing, the inbound (without any modifications done by the proxy server) Request-URI will be used as the History-Info URI.
Meaning of the parameters is as follows:

listitem.para: reason - The reason string to be added as the reason parameter
uri - The URI to be set in History-Info header

section.para: This function can be used from REQUEST_ROUTE, FAILURE_ROUTE, BRANCH_ROUTE.

section.title: History-Info Example
section.para: The following example shows a History-Info header field added to INVITE message. The original INVITE received by the user agent of sip:bob@sip.org is:
section.programlisting: INVITE sip:bob@sip.org SIP/2.0 Via: SIP/2.0/UDP 1.2.3.4:5060 From: "mark" <sip:mark@sip.org>;tag=ldgheoihege To: "Bob" <sip:bob@sip.org> Call-ID: adgasdkgjhkjha@1.2.3.4 CSeq: 3 INVITE Contact: <sip:mark@1.2.3.4> Content-Length: 0
section.para: The INVITE message is diverted by the user agent of sip:bob@sip.org because the user was talking to someone else and the new destination is sip:alice@sip.org :
section.programlisting: INVITE sip:alice@sip.org SIP/2.0 Via: SIP/2.0/UDP 5.6.7.8:5060 Via: SIP/2.0/UDP 1.2.3.4:5060 From: "mark" <sip:mark@sip.org>;tag=ldgheoihege To: "Bob" <sip:bob@sip.org> Call-ID: adgasdkgjhkjha@1.2.3.4 CSeq: 3 INVITE History-Info: <sip:bob@sip.org>;reason=user-busy Contact: <sip:mark@1.2.3.4> Content-Length: 0
